info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:18AM CDT until April 5 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
FFWLZK
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Lawrence County in eastern Arkansas... Central Sharp County in north central Arkansas...
* Until 230 PM CDT.
* At 1118 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area and multiple water rescues were ongoing. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Hardy and Cherokee Village. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cherokee Village... Highland in Sharp County... Hardy... Imboden... Ravenden... Williford... Ozark Acres...
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR HARDY AND CHEROKEE VILLAGE
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 2:30 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 2:30 PM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR HARDY AND CHEROKEE VILLAGE
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 2:30 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 2:30 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
